answers.answer: The answer is complicated. If a patient has diabetes, the body goes to an alternate means of decreasing blood sugar levels. This can cause what are called "Kusmal respirations", which are similar to an asthmatic attack, and occasionally misdiagnosed as such. You need an evaluation for diabetes and a test known as the A1C.
Thanks. What else besides diabetes could cause this?

question: My diagnosis has gotten quite difficult.I almost always get asthma symptoms whenever I feel a little hungry. That is, If I don't eat for a few hours. I don't have hypoglycemia. I don't think it's normal for asthmatics to get attacks due to hunger?  Can anyone point me to the tests I ought to do?
title: Can hunger trigger an Asthma attack?
